0.Pros: The work was easy and the crew members were amazing. The managers trained me to complete my tasks to the best of my ability, and the steady flow of customers practically made my shifts fly by. I am confident I can work in stressful situations and keep a cool mind, and in my ability to deal with a wide range of people.
0.Cons: Fast food was incredibly stressful. The work itself was simple enough, but always being busy and forever working with the bare minimum during afternoon and nightly rushes does take a toll on a person after a while. The only retail-like experience I have was at a Home Depot for a few months last summer, but being able to scan a person's items and send them on their way I found infinitely less nerve wracking.

1.Pros: Work there if you have friends there as well.
1.Cons: Management sucks, not enough training, impatient.

2.Pros: There are no pros to speak of
